1B6fkvBYZtIX5xVjv74bwg.text: The dishes look good but taste extremely awful. As a Chinese, I highly not recommend this restaurant

3bHsdDukAM-grt3FSmf1vA.text: This place is pretty darn good.  The servers were friendly and very helpful when deciding what to order.  There were four of us and we all ordered something different.  When the menu states a dish is spicy-  it is!!!!  My daughter and myself both ordered the two of the spiciest dishes on the menu.  They were delicious.  I had a Korean chicken stir fry.  It was about 1/2 the price of a dish at a Korean restaurant and it was just as good.  My husband ordered the lemongrass dish and it was very aromatic.  My son had the chicken fried rice-  tasty but it needed a bit more soy sauce.  Overall a very good experience and we would return for another visit.

Bmm04354-FoDhhQ_A-YGkQ.text: I was very excited to see this restaurant opening up in my area.  Absolutely love the lettuce wraps and sweet and sour shrimp.  The service was great and speedy for my take out order.

JC1Z62i1msZAnWlgOP1pNw.text: First time customer here. Wanted to ease into the experience so I chose a familiar dish, Pad Thai. It's had to mess up Pad Thai, so it was as good as expected. I will go back and try something else later.

7RLvLtWQhljLYhkvkKdJOQ.text: Foods okay needs more flavor for dishes kinda plane tasting had the teriyaki chicken and was not impressed with the flavor

CTLtzY1t8cAq6aNa19ftjg.text: Chicken in pad thai can usually be very bland.  However this place makes the  chicken taste AMAZING! I can't wait to try the other things on thus menu!

NC_WjrfsfqQTBHpUv7S2Og.text: My first visit and I will return. I ordered the pork egg roll and the Bangkok noodles. I loved the fact that the egg roll looked made in house and not the typical egg roll that's on most menus. That alone would bring me back. The Bangkok noodles had a nice flavor with just the right heat. Only issue for me would be that it's either over sauced or the sauce needs to be thinned out a bit. It was heavy and gloppy on the noodles so I ended up picking through it for the meat and veggies and leaving behind more than half the noodles. Most peanut sauces I've made or ordered were not that heavy

jZ5dDnQF0h12JvZ5p-s7IQ.text: Five stars for service. I did not enjoy a portion of my food but the manager and staff handled it so well. I will definitely be coming back to try more menu items. The spring rolls are amazing .

n6ZtRETEJqLhTxSsfwy1wA.text: Lunch time not packed but very slow.  I'm on over 20 minutes waiting for a TOGO.  Tables are taken up with others waiting for TOGO. Most people have an hour for lunch not to be waiting on food this long!!  One cashier.  One cook.  Lots standing around.

km37s0_kef6FM-ZUgpgO1g.text: Had the Chicken Pad Thai and it was dank. The chicken was very well done and the food was ready very quickly and hot. The service was incredible and I would definitely recommend this restaurant.

KYBrKXNvv2Jb2HcE4qOKUg.text: Very excited to have this option near the university. The staff was very friendly and attentive throughout the ordering, food delivery, and clean up stages. Food was fast, hot, and delicious! Brand new store so everything is clean and has a nice atmosphere.

g0VBAxzUWS66Sn4mPJjMdQ.text: The service was fast and the food was delicious. The other restaurants in this shopping center are unnecessary with this one around. Don't get me wrong, I love five guys- but why do we need so many of them? lol. I had the chicken fried rice and spring rolls. I wish I could have a box of their spring rolls because they were bangin. If you haven't tried it yet you need to. My food was fresh and hot, and the restaurant was clean and inviting.

uiDGFt1MVxvFItDSkfyVGQ.text: I would give them a solid 3 stars. Sometimes food is really fresh and well made and other times kind of so-so. Similar to the location in Ballantyne, it just kind of depends, on what crew is working. Food is not bad though. Service is friendly and fast, which is a plus if you are going on your lunch hour.

__IB4fIwLiNpKt7M0pxWYA.text: As an asian living near the area, my friends and I found the food to be foul and disgusting. Overly seasoned with pepper paste and another dish is butchered with pepper flakes. I dont understand how people could consider this cuisine.

pdW6RhygNWLyuSsYxswXJw.text: Ordered the Teriyaki rice bowl which had a nice balanced flavor. Not too salty like most Americanized Chinese places. Friendly service, however the line was very long and they didnt open a second register until it got to the door. The chicken-to-rice ratio wasn't too great either. My bowl was 60% rice, 25% veggies, 15% meat. For that, I'd say the prices were just okay. Overall, nice experience.

ah8LfNqOO2OTjquo-pnLVQ.text: Horrible food. Please save your money and go somewhere else. Employees and service is great but good is definitely not good. I was sick for 2 days after eating this and didn't even finish the food, just got up and left.

L1-6p1PHwFix5z-44m39tw.text: This new location is ON POINT. I've made multiple to-go orders and each time everything has been made on time and exactly to order! Try the teriyaki chicken, Mongolian beef or pork egg rolls- you won't regret it!

st0kwFwmz4T_iJEY7eu_Bg.text: Went here Sunday to catch up with some friends. Was super excited because I love the lettuce wraps at PF Chang's! So disappointed to be told after paying that they "ran out" of "salad rolls" before watching them give some to a woman in line after me. Had to settle for egg rolls. What a shame that they couldn't keep their very popular lettuce wraps in stock. Not only that, but they gave someone in line after me lettuce wraps that should've been mine. I'm never one to rag on a place or complain, but it was just so frustrating. What a disappointment it was. Also, the Mongolian Beef that I got tasted completely different from the Mongolian Beef that my friend got. Mine was straight up soy sauce and it was awful. At least I got to spend the day with good friends. Not to say that you shouldn't go, but I definitely would rather head over to PF Chang's where I can count on better service and reliable food.

mhoYbyosS3gji8ESr_t82A.text: The food here is okay, but this is exactly the kind of "Asian" restaurant I hate. The food consists of the most trite dishes from multiple Asian cuisines, and is designed to appeal to non-Asian tastes. And they have a sign that says "flavors as rich as the culture," as if there was just one Asian culture. I can't support this place when there are real Asian restaurants within walking distance.

Y_S__r59hEqMzoYBW9YeeA.text: It was my first time at Pei Wei. When I walked in and immediately noticed the decor, everything was so clean and nice. I ordered the Ahi Avocado Salad salad and it was EXCELLENT!!! I will definitely be back soon.

Ql1jrTkxnw6b1IzSyt06cQ.text: This place is stupid. The cashiers are cluelessly stupid, they can't answer simple ass questions. And are to concerned about shooting the shit with their coworkers. Food comes out at different times, and appetizers came out last. Food is meh, portions small. The place is not that good, and just stupid!

ea0qxy8jiooaPN943nGEzg.text: The setup and feel of the restaurant seems like fast food but it is far from that. The food is amazing and it ready at a fast pace. It is worth a try to anyone who enjoys asian. Orange Chicken is amazing!

r5iPpbvtB3rXIL4VJxnJxQ.text: New place. Located near to University. Staff friendly and welcoming. Good number of options. Tried Teriyaki Crunchy rolls and Korean Spicy Chicken. Tasty and spicy. Will visit again to try others. Will recommend this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Pei Wei - Charlotte, NC, United States. Thai Dynamite..
Photo of Pei Wei - Charlotte, NC, United States. Crispy Shrimp spicy sushi
Photo of Pei Wei - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pei Wei Spicy

-MDNxhX2L-dHhmU5YkAVZg.text: Dinner was delicious and left my tastebuds dancing!! Everything was free and hot when served!

photos.caption: Photo of Pei Wei - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sweet and Sour Chicken regular
Photo of Pei Wei - Charlotte, NC, United States. Honey Seared Tofu small

C-6nh1z2MBpzRFOkf0kapg.text: Very underwhelming! I ordered a small sweet and sour chicken with white rice and a spring roll. It was not good at all. The sauce was very bland, the snap peas and the chicken were both soggy, the canned pineapples were mush. As far as the spring roll goes, it was mediocre at best, brown veggies on the inside and not seasoned at all.   Overall save your time and money and try one of the other restaurants in the area!

ycwkx-1jUDWtbfZanRd9pw.text: Really good prices but the chicken pad Thai doesn't even hold a candle to Thai house which is right down the road. Probably won't be eating here again. Chicken was dry, there was barely any sauce. Pretty bland for a dish that's meant to be full of flavor.

S6Fe3WRIlcXLgCx9QEMQlg.text: Restaurant is clean and staffed with friendly people. However the food is less than desirable. Ordered the dan dan noodles with steak. What I received was spaghetti noodles with stew beef/pot roast on top. Stew beef/ pot roast is NOT steak, so they need to change their menus to show the correct type of meat. Food was overall bland and needed more sauce. Not recommended if you want good food, but if you like bland food and good service it's for you. Food is over priced for the cheap cuts of meat and low quality of the ingredients used. For such a simple dish, you'd think it would be better. If you want food with flavor, I would recommend Noodles and Company next door. They actually use steak!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pei Wei - Charlotte, NC, United States. Dan Dan Noodles with &#34;steak&#34;

f3i-Ivx9f7IAGW_ew8-Bjg.text: I ordered vegetable fried rice and vegetable pad thai to go. First of all, the portions were huge. I was surprised when I saw how big the containers were. I found the pad thai tastier than the fried rice. The fried rice was flavorless. It was definitely filling though. I would like to try other dishes, so I will return.  My husband ordered the Korean bulgogi and General Tso's chicken and he thought it was good. He said it's a good lunch spot.

mHGCa6r05129J30hsT72ow.text: I tried this place because it was new to the new expansion in university.  When i came during the first mont h that it was open.  It was a little unorganized but the staff was really pleasant. The food wasn't anything to rave about but was decent. It seems like a  healthy american version of chinese food. Im not sure if i will return again just because the food didn't wow me and it was a little pricey for what you get.

Aywdt7oN4AHYbUgmyFJjdA.text: First time, called in takeout order, food was ready when I got there and was delicious! Glad this place is so convenient to me because I will definitely be back! Service was also very good.

oC02S4rs0FkdkoVkyK5Ryw.text: I have a a gluten allergy so I was apprehensive to go but to my delight they offer tasty gluten free options on the menu. I had the sweet n sour shrimp bowl with brown rice. I couldn't believe the shrimp was gluten free. The food was fast and fresh and the staff was so helpful. My mom ate there two days I a row she liked it so much which says a lot.

tdFFTEy6U6M48DEAbEfdRQ.text: Food was very bland, they really need to add some more seasoning to the food.  The fired rice, which costs 99 cents extra, was the worst fried rice i think i have ever had; even Panda has better fried rice.  I got the curry chicken dish and it was very disappointing; I don't know what they think curry chicken should look like but it was not even yellow/green.  I really could not find even a hint of curry in this dish.  Oh well, $13.19 wasted on lunch today.

1hKeVWTYuHw2ePhYvw7Lkw.text: Great food! There's a lot of variety of Asian dishes. The Pad Thai is one of the best around. The restaurant was very clean and the staff was very helpful. Would recommend this if you're in the University area looking for Asian food.

xgw1lfB7S8lRjG6ULNQwyA.text: I've traveled nearly around the world trying all types of food from Mexico to France. Pei Wei may have a fast food feel but the service removes that. The bathrooms are clean. Clean bathroom means clean kitchen. The staff are very friendly. From the person at the register who remembered me. The manager came around and asked if we were ok  and needed anything. Me and my wife have had nothing but an all around great experience during each visit. I will be swinging in again real soon.

WY2IgdewtDxr4wb3F6E8RA.text: Ahi avocado tuna salad was better than any fancy restaurant salad I've ever ordered! Fresh ingredients, great presentation and just enough dressing. I'll be returning next week for this.

Inl8sJvIcD5lhbTeyrP8ug.text: Food was mediocre at best.  We ordered hot & sour soup, thai chicken lettuce wrap and a Japanese noodle bowl with shrimp and beef.   Don't think I'll be going back anytime soon.

jHN5SDHLP-QOvIfj6m3BFQ.text: Great food! So glad to see a new place in university that has a fresh menu, great staff, and decent prices. I ordered mangolian steak! Tasty. Can't wait to try the sushi next

yoGBUBxERB_rOiv0I2_XWA.text: This franchisee is doing a terrible job running this place compared to the one in Ballantyne. They are always understaffed and disorganized. A very busy Saturday night, all the surrounding restaurants are packed and this place has 1 wok cook! There were 6 in our party and the meals came out one at a time! The first person served was almost done their meal about the time the sixth person got theirs! The soda machine was missing half the choices and we were told someone was coming next Monday to replenish the tanks. The faucet in the ice tea container was dripping and the catch tray was full so it was leaking all over the counter and the floor. The food quality was not great, no fortune cookies, no soda cup lids, the floors were sticky! Won't be frequenting this restaurant again unless things improve dramatically!

UwjXMPuo9XNA0tyUIlBn7A.text: The food "looks good" and it sounds very "Asian". The staff are fantastical helpful and nice. After getting the food, I couldn't help but almost everything was deep fried. My ramen noodle wasn't ramen at all. It tasted a bit like spaghetti with some spicy Asian sauce. This was my first time at Pei Wei and prob my last because of they way the food taste.

xEqtLzIntxxc4UUChDJmjQ.text: New spot and new spins on the traditional. I love the traditional lettuce wraps. The location is great as there is plenty parking. I want to suggest the poke bowl and Dan Dan noodles which is a huge portion with tons of flavor.

photos.caption: Photo of Pei Wei - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Pei Wei - Charlotte, NC, United States. Traditional Lettuce Wrap.. Smokey, spicy and delicious low carb alternative.

fv3AZQUwEGilFJKnqyPuLA.text: Came here on a whim for lunch. Kept seeing the $5 advertisement for the new orange chicken, so why not! The atmosphere is trendy and welcoming. The cashier was friendly and welcoming. I ordered brown rice and a spring roll to go. The spring roll was crispy and full of spring roll deliciousness.  The sweet chili sauce was a nice touch with the vegetables. The orange chicken had a good flavor, but something was missing. It was tender, but needed something to make it pop. Maybe because it wasn't crispy could've been the difference between ehh and good! I'll return to try one of the other many items on the menu...so the the stars could increase on another visit.

78krLIpQzAdTdH1f815jlg.text: I love to come here for many reasons. The atmosphere is always nice and clean. The food options are endless. My favorite is the general tso and the sesame chicken. You can ask for fried rice and it is so yummy! They have the nicest to go containers too. I will be back.

gcqvHtscH1ekWe-tMl7lJQ.text: Very bad sushi. Ordered thru Foodsby for work and rice was hard, I think it was sushi from the day before.

984_oS8cCu5YkstvSOTaCA.text: This place was one of my take-outs sometimes. I happen to visit here once and my favorite is chicken lettuce wraps.

eApKjgjM9z0uKqZVqMX-iA.text: Great service food was delicious..they give student discounts. Food served HOT! Bon appetit

X-0dTBRu172aHqC396MMHw.text: The food here is just okay. I ordered the Korean spicy shrimp I believe on greens, boy I didn't think it would be that spicy but beware the spice is there! I didn't like how much sauce my dish was drenched in either. The food wasn't bad, but I wouldn't find myself "craving" pei wei.

nyJojyTRY_eIPdqlAu-G7Q.text: My experience at this location wasn't the best. I've been to the ones on the west coast so I was having high hopes but was let down. Went back and forth with the cashier about what I wanted to eat. I kept telling her I wanted chicken and shrimp ... she'd state back to me chicken and steak... I'd look back and repeat myself for four more times before she put my order in. I ordered extra broccoli received a plate of just chicken and rice no broccoli I paid for or shrimp. My plate got taken back at least 3 times before I was able to eat my food.   There wasn't any clean tables anywhere due to a lunch rush I assume but I was able to find one that wasn't too bad. With all the issues I had that day I think I'm okay on pei wei for now.

Zzi9dM5v1lm0bsiEQaEQNA.text: Service- the lady who took my order was friendly and willing to engage in light conversation as we waited for my food to be prepared. This was my first time and I communicated as such tho the cashier. I ended up spending more than expected on a small entree because the cashier offered so many options/alternatives to my meal that I didn't realize had additional costs. For example: rice bowl or noodle bowl? Noodles are extra. As nice as the cashier was I felt hoodwinked and thibk it would have been kinder for her to explain that extra charges would be incurred since I was a newbie. Live and learn. Food- I ordered a small ginger and broccoli over noodles with chicken. It was...small. Certainly tasty! I was disappointed to count only six chicken chunks for what I paid. Even less broccoli.  Would I go back? Probably not on my accord but I wouldn't kick or scream to return.

JaYWMK0aXZTzHw2txOpxEw.text: I've been here to eat in as well as carry out several times, the most recent being this past week. I'd strongly recommend the lettuce wraps (as a meal) and I think the ginger broccoli shrimp is my new favorite indulgence. I'm bummed they took their Thai chicken lettuce wraps off the menu shortly after they opened (there used to be two different kinds, now there is one). While I'm a big fan of their food, I think their service could use some work. When eating in during lunch, it feels like it takes a while for the food to come out (which it's fresh when it does come out, but I'm limited when I can go for lunch due to the time constraints of my workday). So, this past week, I decided to order through their app for a designated pick-up time. They open at 11, so I selected 11:30 for my pick up. I then placed a second order for a coworker for 11:40 pickup.  I arrived at 11:30 and my food from my first order was not ready and neither were the lettuce wraps I had ordered second. I ended up not getting out of there until at least 11:50 which was disappointing considering I ordered in advance for a set pickup time (especially on the first order that I placed before they were even open).

KmR_dlYrNBfg3rJ-qyZaRA.text: I was very excited we got a Pei Wei in the University area since options are limited. The establishment is orderly and modern. The menu has plenty of choices. I ordered crab rangoons and won ton soup. The won ton soup was very tasty... with hints of basil and lemon. It tasted fresh and more upscale than your typical fast casual Chinese food. The crab rangoons are fashioned with real crab which I was not expecting. They were quite tasty. My husband had the steak dan dan noodles and they were lacking flavor. My friend had the honey severed chicken and it also lacked flavor. There was no sriacha or salt to be found... this deducted two stars for me. I hope yo find other dishes with the same flavor as he appetizers.

lgg1boEMlq_BQFEhyEYkOg.text: It wasn't a bad place but at the same time it's not a place that I'm dying to go to again.  The girl that took my order was very nice and pleasant, but after placing the order we had no place to sit because although the restaurant was not even a quarter full there were no clean tables. The food was actually good but again, my first experience was kinda ruined by me having to clean my own table, which wouldn't normally be an issue, but there were no napkins!  So the question is will I go there again?  Sure, why not! But I will make sure to look around for clean tables before I place my order.

y-WvHIvbnphP-qCzZHrxtw.text: First time. Had the Thai Dynamite for lunch. Had the largest size and couldn't eat it all. Delicious. My lunch mate had  the Mongolian rice bowl and she said it was delicious as well. Great service, clean. Lots of choices on the menu.

gLDM7gOq5BDVtFUk7gFKzA.text: So I normally don't eat here, but today decided to online order from Pei Wei. My boyfriend picked up the order. On my online transaction it listed the pick up time as 7:50. My boyfriend was told at 8:00 that it would take 30 minutes. After another 20 or so minutes, after he paid, he was told that they ran out of chicken (that was on both of our dishes) and that they could exchange it for shrimp or steak. At this point, it didn't even look like they had started on the dish, so we opted out and got a refund for our meal. Honestly the food here isn't bad, but just pretty ridiculous that they couldn't tell us they didn't have any chicken until he had already waited 20 minutes.

faY6bwE9tgDp6pxOlpeXoA.text: I am a sushi lover so I know my fish and what it should taste like. I was very excited for a place near my house with a poke bowl option. I'm pretty sure the fish they used in my bowl was not fresh. It smelled very very fishy. So had I couldn't eat half my bowl. Sorry. But not worth the money. I gave one extra star because half the bowl didn't taste bad.   8/15 I decided to give this place another shot, and try the poke bowl one more time. I refused to believe that they would serve me such bad smelly fish the first. This time the fish was much more fresh and didn't smell at all. Overall the bowl was really good.

1-xuJB6Kp8wVINTnU2GHyg.text: One of my favorite places is finally in north Charlotte! their food and service has been consistently good at every location and their prices are reasonable for a large portion. They have a large variety of Asian food, much of which is fresh and healthy. They really have something for everyone!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pei Wei - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Pei Wei - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Pei Wei - Charlotte, NC, United States

sPBdieuA7wlLHyQg4Xh6Zw.text: It's nice that you don't have to give tip honestly, but with the awesome service they have I'm tempted to. The only problem that occurred was the line to order was extremely long but it's understandable knowing this restaurant is fairly new. I ordered the Thai soup to start and it was delicious but definitely smaller than what I expected. I also got the Korean Spicy Chkn, which was very good and I definitely recommend if you like spicy. The rice dishes have 3/4 rice and 1/4 chicken. But with the sauce, it mixes well. I got a small size and it was a perfect portion for me. My boyfriend got the teriyaki chicken and it was good as well. It had very nice flavors and he got the larger size. Definitely filling for him. The flavors of everything was good. Not too salty or too bland. I'd definitely come back. Especially for my free cookie  (take a survey online)

FQezinzyAKaUjp42udBoYg.text: Used to be one of my favorite spots. The food and atmosphere was usually great. However, since the split from P.F. Changs, this location seems to have went down hill. The last three times I've eaten there, my sushi had already fallen apart when served, my crab wontons were burnt, and the rice bowl (1 mongolian beef, 2 sweet and sour chicken) were not up to usual par. The portions, for one, have seen a large decrease it seems. The rice has been dry all three times, and the s&s chicken was complete slop. Thick sauce to the point the breading was falling off. Mongolian beef was ok, but really tough where as it used to be a go to because it was tender and flavorful. I came back twice hoping I had just hit a few bad trips, but this last visit was just to use my rewards (free entree) that I accrued. Very disappointed as this used to by my favorite Asian fare.

xMkQ0Q4rVC7xsu1WCS4zoQ.text: Heard nothing but good things about this place. I'm not a local to the area, so based off friends, we decided to give it a try. Ordered off the app for pick up, which was fairly easy to navigate. The ability to customize was great as some eaters in our group are picky and were easily able to accommodate removing veggies. Between ordering a regular general tso, and a small orange chicken, I was pretty disappointed to get the exact same size dishes between the two. The rice choice we ordered with the orange chicken was brown but it was served with white rice. The pork egg rolls were burned and the box was full of grease. The vegetable lo mein was noodles swimming in soy sauce. The place it's self was pretty dirty. The floor was super sticky through the entire place. The stainless steel throughout was covered in handprints and in high places even. The drink station was covered in spilled liquids. The staff was 50/50 for friendliness. Some acknowledged you, including some of the cooks, and some didn't bother to acknowledge your presence at all. Overall, this wasn't a great experience and the food was sub par for the price.

photos.caption: Photo of Pei Wei - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Pei Wei - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Pei Wei - Charlotte, NC, United States

x0hDbHAxhPNIr7bHm5PCug.text: Typical fusion Chinese  fast food  chain. Ordered orange chicken with brown rice. Salty!!! It was okay.

mm0WDd1QBCTj0yuVB17wfQ.text: Before I started eating I noticed that the silverware plates and bowls are not cleaned you cold see and feel the dirtiness on your silverware and plates

0eTPpZnSFYOYEm30NuPc8g.text: Pei Wei is ok.  That's just it.  It has a fast food feel, which maybe I don't like so much.  they have some pretty decent prices and they are fast.  They have a menu up front to look at while standing in line, so hopefully you will have your mind made up when you get to the register.  You order, then take a pager, then they buzz you when it's ready.    I ordered a noodle dish and a 4 piece sushi appetizer.  The sushi was ok.  It wasn't bad, but tasted fast food-ish (if that's a thing).  I wouldn't order it again, just because it was sort of bland.  The noodle dish was also decent, but do not....I repeat DO NOT get the rice sticks in any of your dishes.  They are so disgusting.  They are supposed to be crispy and give an extra crunch, but they are stale and soggy.  So gross!  Overall....it's quick...it's cheap, but just not somewhere I would consistently pick.

photos.caption: Photo of Pei Wei - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Pei Wei - Charlotte, NC, United States

A1IanpyxHKpPL0qhk2NyUQ.text: I'm out of town on business and this is the first time I've ever eaten at this chain I went with the Bento box looked good however when everything came here's the skinny hot and sour soup was like glue and tasted like  salt the pork eggroll tasted like they had change the grease in the fryer in about a year to greasy the salad had so much I oil on it I couldn't eat it the cauliflower rice was drenched in oil the chicken that I got ended up being raw see picture I ate most of it till I got to the last couple pieces and didn't realize until I cut into it and it's raw!!! How do you serve this kind of food They did offer me a refund or to remake the dish but at that point I probably already eaten raw chicken! I will give a lot of credit to the owner of this business he responded with in 24 hours excepted responsibility and wanted to look into the matter right Away thank you to the owner for looking into this ASAP I'm going to delete the review so as not to damage the business because he responded so quickly it's obvious he cares about his customers and the food and this was clearly an isolated incident

photos.caption: Photo of Pei Wei - Charlotte, NC, United States. Raw chicken!

CUxd30OZIH6KQrm1LvvGRQ.text: This was my first time there.   Inside: nice place not a lot of wall decor. It's more like a cafe' style set up, nothing fancy. I did a Togo order so I did not get a full experience. Plus it was not packed (I went around lunch time).   The food was good not great but good. The young lady who take my order was nice.   Next visit I will review more. I was rushing because I had to leave.

photos.caption: Photo of Pei Wei - Charlotte, NC, United States. Small Honey Seared Shrimp with Quinoa price $ 10.95
Photo of Pei Wei - Charlotte, NC, United States. They serve beer and wine
Photo of Pei Wei - Charlotte, NC, United States. UNCC discounts

LuNwH_fmiW0rE3EXhJbfwA.text: If you are not eating there...order online! I've never eaten there, and my first time I ordered to go and had a bit of a wait.  I've eaten here four times within two weeks. It has gotten to be a problem. Part of it is because I don't feel guilty about eating the lettuce wraps because...NO CARBS! I have had both but the original has more flavor, the Thai is a little more spicy. I've also had the Kung Pao Shrimp rolls...OMG, so incredible. I've also tried the ahi tuna rolls, I don't like them nearly as much as the kung pao.   They are a bit pricey so I don't know how much longer I'll be able to keep this up.  Update: Didn't I say this place would be a problem for me...I decided to look up nutritional information for the lettuce wraps today (insert face palm emoji HERE!) They have from 40-70 grams of carbs! And I've been inhaling them. And I wondered how I had gained two pounds at my weigh-in with my trainer. Help me, Lawd :'(

photos.caption: Photo of Pei Wei - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Pei Wei - Charlotte, NC, United States

g1uVrbklMp5RAB2UGGtU2A.text: My absolute go to Chinese spot! I had a severe shellfish allergy and have NEVER had a reaction eating here. I love the app! Order on your way and walk right in for the ultimate night of take out! This restaurant is part of the "pf Chang" family and their dishes taste similar but for a quarter of the price! At least try it!

Nzb2M8lEGOBpO7bT-9THfw.text: Let me start by saying this is one of my favorite restaurants in Charlotte. In fact we drove 3 hrs round trip for Mother's Day today. The food was good as usual. My complaint is how absolutely filthy the place was. The floors in the dining room were so sticky my shoes stuck to them in a serious way. The stickiness continued into the ladies room where it got even worse. The floors were absolutely black with gunk that had been there a long time. These floors didn't get this way on one busy holiday. When was the last time they were cleaned and degreased?  It breaks my heart to see a place I like so much, be so neglected by it's management. It doesn't matter how good the food and the service are at any establishment; if the place is dirty, I can't eat there. Please do a deep clean and I will be back and give a better review.

zn7mNBnrciUy-AIaqWrKdA.text: I'm loving this new addition to the University area! I literally tried this place twice in one week just make sure my review would be great (lol I love food and was just wanted to try another menu item since I couldn't make up my mind the first time, but let's stick to it being about the review).   You have a bright menu to look over when you first walk in as well as menu in front of the cashier where you can go over the details of different items (don't take too long though). The first visit led me to try the Mongolian rice bowl and once I ordered, the cashier handed me a pager that would vibrate once my meal was ready in the pick up area. The second visit led me to try the sesame rice bowl, but I ate it before snapping a picture. Both meals were about $9 for a regular size serving.   If you open up your to-go dish or look at your plate and think you've been shorted...you haven't. The meat and saucy goodness is under the rice, so just mix it all together!   The service was...meh, but I also went when it was busy. By all means don't take my word for it... go check them out!

photos.caption: Photo of Pei Wei - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Pei Wei - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Pei Wei - Charlotte, NC, United States

7RDg7GnBLD8ERtLggTCdcQ.text: The food wasn't what I thought it would be like... I ordered the shrimp and steak noodles, and the steak was under cook partly raw in some areas and they only gave me two pieces of shrimp. Very sweet with teriyaki sauce and they used the cheapest cut of steak which in my opinion felt like bubblegum as I chewed it. Yuck! Thumbs down for Pei Wei.  Eat there at your own risk

photos.caption: Photo of Pei Wei - Charlotte, NC, United States

tLqH83WV2YsKt4glBRQqGQ.text: Food tasted good but the value was quite poor.  I've eaten at PW many times, but never previously at this location.  The "large" size portion was only large in terms of how much rice was on the plate.  The quantity of meat was disappointingly small.  When I brought it to the attention of the worker, it was immediately brushed off as being "enough".  I don't recommend this location because of the service and the value.

photos.caption: Photo of Pei Wei - Charlotte, NC, United States. Disproportionate rice-to-meat ratio

0mHi48jMIeV1HTnjLWbYAg.text: It was our first time and the dishes were disappointing. We ordered two make your own bowls, a green salad and a sushi. The sushi was tasteless (I am a sushi lover but this was not something that want to eat). The taste of the food was OK but I didn't like enjoy my dish as the ingredients were not fresh (the steam broccoli and the other vegetables in the salad were not in a good condition).

PrqVarz_tKj3VULDoxVmDg.text: This place looks nice but it nasty once you scratch the surface. Bathrooms were gross, dead roach in the floor. Walked to three different tables before finding one that was clean. Kitchen staff is visible, could see them touching their face and hair without breaking to wash their hands. Both coke machines were down when we arrived, bought a soda and they didn't tell us we wouldn't be able to get one until we we're halfway finished eating. The food was alright, but not worth the $. Next time I see a 94 on their health inspection score I guess I'll turn the other way. We wondered why it was empty when we arrived, now I know.

lSEdiZIZohl3LNSpvtdVdw.text: Food looks good. That's why 1 star We ordered kids meals, Ahi Tuna salad, pad Thai   All was left as we got it. 2 bites enough to understand the level  Spring rolls were Oil rolls  Not going back, neither should you It's Junk good in the price of a full blown restaurant. Sorry.

photos.caption: Photo of Pei Wei - Charlotte, NC, United States

SpqTl12Is9e65mKyUtLCRA.text: Went to check this place out this week. I'm a fan of Panda Express, heard it's 'better'. Definitely better choices on the menu, I liked what I saw. Food is made to order, so not as fast. Went with a buddy, ordered separate, had to wait for him to get his food. That's about the biggest negative.  Otherwise, the taste was good. Portion a little small for the price, but I've had worse. Lol. I'd recommend to those in the UC area liking for a quick fix for Chinese food.

b1ngIZ0Nf38fY4NRpbQiEA.text: Expensive for what you get. But it's a chain so nothing that'll change that. What can change is how poor their customer service is. The girl taking my order got annoyed that I couldn't hear her and started yelling everything at me. I have never had someone act like that in a restaurant. Of course I've had bad service but nothing like that. Very irritating. Will not be returning and will let people know about the service here

gRjPeUkWdosO6d4MCThAfQ.text: Good spot for a quick bite to eat for lunch, General Tso chicken is good they also have great noodle plates.

photos.caption: Photo of Pei Wei - Charlotte, NC, United States. Looking for fast asian fusion spot for lunch. This spot is good.
Photo of Pei Wei - Charlotte, NC, United States

lKhULC49NjG0lQbUMme3ZQ.text: I use to love Pei Wei, but this location has made me change my mind. We are leaving plates half full. It just sucked. Also the whole restaurant looks dirty. The manager looked filthy. The employees are lost. Seriously avoid this place and I use to recommend this place. Omg, I'm sick just setting here looking at this horrible looking plate of food!

photos.caption: Photo of Pei Wei - Charlotte, NC, United States. Orange chicken. Tasted like orange crap. With soggy egg rolls

TyYiO2-dW6u-GA5cgD2vNQ.text: One word needed: MOUSE.  Food was mediocre but my appetite was suppressed once we saw the mouse run across the floor. Never. Again.

sDV72_Iyg2CisNFg2NCTKw.text: 1- Service isn't the greatest, just average. 2- I ordered sesame chicken w/ brown rice... tastes like something I would buy out of the freezer section at Trader Joe's but Trader Joe's Chinese food is actually 10x better than this ever will be! 3- MOUSE. They had 4-5 tables near the window blocked off with "wet floor signs" and taped "reserved" onto them??? A word of advice to management: if you have a mouse problem, I don't think it would've hurt the business to close temporarily for an hour or two while you try to get the problem under control. That would have potentially saved your reputation by not having two reviews that say "MOUSE" on them... Hope that problem is fixed for future customers, but I sure will not be returning!

v6ooG_1G4CbW3qv-HgzDXw.text: Once upon a time there was a chain called Mama Fu's and it was my favorite fast-casual Asian food spot. The food was great and so was the service. Then all of the area locations closed and I've been lost for years trying to find something similar.   Yesterday I found found the perfect replacement in Pei Wei.  The restaurant is spacious, clean, and modern.  The service was great, from the ordering to the delivery of the food to the multiple table side visits to make sure we had everything we needed.  Now on to the food...  I ordered a kid's sweet & sour chicken with brown rice and apple juice for my toddler. I loved that the sauced items were placed in the bottom of the bowl, the rice on top, and the veggies were steamed and not tossed in sauce.   I ordered the spicy Polynesian poke bowl, the current special. I didn't love it but I also didn't hate it. It was okay but I'm also a bit poke bowl snob so my standard is a bit high.   We'll definitely be back and I can't wait to try the rest of the menu!

photos.caption: Photo of Pei Wei - Charlotte, NC, United States. Kid&#39;s Sweet &amp; Sour Chicken with Brown Rice
Photo of Pei Wei - Charlotte, NC, United States. Spicy Polynesian Poke Bowl

_CTBXVohYyMCvzk1FDhGsQ.text: The general manager here, Melvin, was an absolute blessing to me.  I walked in having not ever eaten here before and he went over the entire menu and what he recommended. I was with my two young boys and he got a highchair ready for me and was just beyond helpful.  The food was a little dry, could have used a more seasoning.  By far, the customer service was the best though, I will always remember Melvin, such a sweetheart!

r6B43crIRvtwbhDQhgXOuQ.text: When you arrive at a chain establishment, there are certain expectations that you expect that chain to meet - no matter the location. Some exceed those expections and some fall short. Sadly, for this location, the latter held True. Everything was bland, cut unevenly, and dripping in sauce. In a center with many food options, their quality just doesn't warrant me returning.   I went for a bento box, which is great, because you get a little bit of everything you love - an appetizer, sushi, salad and an entree - but all in manageable portions. I went for the ginger chicken with cauliflower rice, salad, potstickers and the wasabi crunch roll. I'll start by saying the mini potstickers were amazing. They had great flavor, crunch, and a small drizzle of sauce to tie it all together. My wasabi crunch roll was very unevenly cut and the wasabi peas on the roll were definitely stale and soft. My salad was dripping in dressing, and the dressing itself was overly salty. As for my ginger chicken, the pieces were all uneven, and one was rock hard, which was an absolute turn off.   What was a lunch I was looking forward to ended up being a big disappointment.

photos.caption: Photo of Pei Wei - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bento box

Fx7plzhFtFW4YbSCUGYNOA.text: Been here quite a few times and each time they managed to disappoint me in some way.   Whether it's the lack of flavor in the snap peas, the overcooked steak or the lack of ingredients in most of their dishes... I just don't see myself giving them more chances to make me wish I went somewhere else.   Also, they may be trying to kill their customers with the slippery mats by the drink area.  Every time it's wet and dangerous.   Save yourself from a broken heart and pelvis - skip this location.

GFBb-QSWh9RUBHR2dmVv9Q.text: Although normally I check the yelp reviews before going into a restaurant.. this time we didn't.   After a great jog at the board walk. We walked across the street to this Location .. it looked empty outside. And we were hungry and sweaty. They had an outside sitting area.   So when we got inside it was pretty empty. Only a lady sitting alone. And a couple, whom looked upset.    We went and looked and ordered a bento box (I believe their called) because it looked like the easiest and you got to custom make it.   My son got the chicken teriyaki with rice He choose the crunchy sushi. And he got the meat pot sticks and the salad which we asked no tomatoes. ( if course it came with tomatoes when it arrived)   I got the shrimp with cauliflower rice. I asked for the California sushi and for the Crab ragon. And the veggie side. Which everything was cold.     Except the sushi. They had run out and had to replace it with an spring roll which had huge mushroom strips.   They request it to add the spring roll for me bc they ran out .. but the mixed it up and replaced his crunchy sushi too .. so we didn't get to try none of the sushi.   Over all. We paid 23 bucks for food that wasn't even warm anymore. But it was a cute set up.

photos.caption: Photo of Pei Wei - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Pei Wei - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Pei Wei - Charlotte, NC, United States

efvjZJQT5EgXG3ucX0ehhQ.text: This was 3rd visit to Pei Wei at this location.  When I came into Pei Wei there was only one person taking orders and 1 person ahead of me.  I waited for approximately 15 minutes before the server took my order.  Each time I visited this location I had to wipe the table off. The eating area, including the drinking area is always dirty/uncleaned. My order comes up quick but the food is bland. My steak was overcooked.  I guess I am comparing this location to the Ballantyne location and there is a major difference in the services, cleanliness and the taste of the food. I'm only writing this review because I want them to do better and I want to like this restaurant.

i4PNj9WWZ1dKxb-khNnerQ.text: This dish was incredible! I love that they offered cauliflower rice as most places don't. The chicken was super, super crispy and delicious. The sauce paired so nicely with the cauliflower rice as well.  Highly recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Pei Wei - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sesame chicken and cauliflower rice

sEL13CsRU6fU8l9qqzh_ig.text: This place has some of the best egg rolls around. I love their mango sushi and the pad thai is very good and filling also. The staff here is very helpful and respectful but I did notice several dirty tables throughout the restaurant.

9bsb6WuMb5rO1MEEbOwhIw.text: Been here several times for lunch, the place is clean and the staff is always very friendly. I've tried a few different menu items and so far the Kung pao chicken is my favorite. This is much different and better than most of the regular Chinese take out places I've frequented in the past. I would definitely recommend checking this place out.

photos.caption: Photo of Pei Wei - Charlotte, NC, United States. Dining room
Photo of Pei Wei - Charlotte, NC, United States. Front line

h3vmnvXbC7ZF2l3Khxzrug.text: Not a good sign once walking toward the counter your feet sticks like the dirty floor of a movie theater. First time visiting this place. This restaurant is no exception in following the trend of not having table service. Prices were meh... food was meh. I ordered the Bento Box with tofu and wife ordered the fried rice and veggies with tofu. I ate her tofu and I gave her my sushi and pot stickers. I would have given rating higher if I could have subbed out the non-vegan stuff for a spring roll or some broccoli but cashier was clueless. At he end of the visit nothing was impressive or exceptional. Short note that I was a little puzzled that the sriracha was up high out of customer reach as apparently used for decoration?! I probably will not come back :-( due to other tastier, friendlier and economical options.

r4xWUOOMsvEwmEr1BbTzlg.text: Eh...it was "okay". I was not really impressed by my meal. I ordered tuna sushi rolls and a side of steamed veggies. I assumed the veggies would be mixed, but it was mostly carrots and just a few pieces of snap peas and broccoli. My sushi roll was mediocre, definitely not fresh. Also the sushi was more rice than anything else.   I ordered carry-out, but liked the style of the restaurant when I picked up. My mother had steak + shrimp ramen and ordered extra shrimp for it. I'll just say I guess that if she had not ordered "extra" then she would not have had any shrimp at all or just 1-2... However, she REALLY liked it and is looking forward to going again. Sooo I guess that would be the circumstance that I would visit here again...

photos.caption: Photo of Pei Wei - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tuna sushi
Photo of Pei Wei - Charlotte, NC, United States. Side of steamed veggies...mostly carrots.

XUKc7IW-ZcQtUWXfw64VMg.text: Let me start by saying my family, and I are actually huge fans of Pei Wei. If Could give this particular Pei Wei 0 stars I would. The picture above doesn't justify how horrible this food was. This is supposed to be "sweet and sour chicken, with fried rice". To start, the "fried rice" was extremely dry, and mushy. The chicken was also dry, and pretty much had no sweet and sour sauce. The snap peas were cold, and basically raw(no big deal, they're snap peas) BUT the rest of the dish was HOT. In addition, not shown in the picture was what I ordered, and it was honestly just as bad if not worse. Very disappointing! My Fiance is pregnant, so eating at Pei Wei is pretty much ruined.

photos.caption: Photo of Pei Wei - Charlotte, NC, United States

2hihlRjBYET2JtAXZly2rA.text: The food us made to order. It comes outs out fast, hot and fresh. The portions are great especially for the price. You will not leave hunger. I enjoy how I am allowed to personalize order to meet my dietary needs. Plus they have the Freestyle Coke beverage dispensers.  I have been here several times for lunch and a few times for dinner.  The cashier/server Stacie is always friendly knowledgeable and seemingly always here. All of which are qualities I enjoy. She has introduced me to my new lettuce wraps. You can try the small for 1.99. I did and I have been hooked ever since thanks to Stacie.  My mom is a vegan and Stacie helped me make selections for her too.   Don't discount this place because they are chain. This place runs like a non-chain restaurant. Gove them a try.

photos.caption: Photo of Pei Wei - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Pei Wei - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Pei Wei - Charlotte, NC, United States

-BCkrigdTUQxWS6tsIh5AQ.text: I am from Arizona, so I know ALL about this place. My husband and I were driving around UNCC and my husband almost go into an accident because of how EXCITED I got when I saw this establishment. He has never been here before so we decided to stop by. (Honestly... we didn't decide, I DID) lol. It was just as amazing as I remembered. Super fast service. We ordered and sat down. Within 5-10 minutes our food was being served to us! We both ordered the Chicken Pad Thai and Chicken Lettuce Wraps as an appetizer. BOY IT WAS SOOOO WORTH IT. My husband said it was worth almost getting into an accident. Lol. Will definitely be coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of Pei Wei - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Pei Wei - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Pei Wei - Charlotte, NC, United States

UEZOZy1Q94uFEaMaL6Ah-g.text: Meh. The food is not that great but it's good for what it is, where it is. Meaning, if you have the slightest craving for Chinese/Asian food and don't want to spend that much, Pei Wei is good for you.  The menu is brightly lit and up on the immediate left side when you walk in. There are two lanes - one for pick up of call in/online orders and the other for walk ins/carry out service.   Of the meals I've had, I've not re-ordered any of them. I'm hoping to find something worth ordering to again is the reason I come back. Otherwise, stick with your favorite authentic Chinese/Asian restaurant for quality food.

photos.caption: Photo of Pei Wei - Charlotte, NC, United States. Dan dan noodles
Photo of Pei Wei - Charlotte, NC, United States. Small portion of spicy chicken (brown) rice bowl to-go

owDJ4UH9HT88QBG94Ep5Kg.text: Very disappointing. I have been to Pei Wei restaurants all over the country and this was by far the worst. We had Kung Pao Chicken and Mongolian Beef. Both meats were so over cooked that we could hardly chew them into pieces. The sauces were horrible and entirely too thick. Sadly, we will never return.

CWDkg81odD150ocSim0waA.text: Literally just sad  Pad Thai was flavorless, not spicy at all, the sauce was watery. The Thai donuts were over cooked bad. Edamame was not cooked all the way...literally a Postmates order that went this terribly wrong. My boyfriend said the Korean spicy wasn't spicy either....The only think I enjoyed was the soy sauce that came in the bag

photos.caption: Photo of Pei Wei - Charlotte, NC, United States. Wow their sushi is definitely authentic!!
Photo of Pei Wei - Charlotte, NC, United States. &#34;Sushi&#34;....yeah okay.

S4Glb36MDAxJDMeQk7nL9A.text: Fast service on a Friday evening. It was my first visit and the food was neatly prepared upon ordering.  I ordered sushi. It was so good I finished it in the car before I got home.  Good customer service also.  That's what I appreciate about any business I patronize.  I'll return unless it changes. No complaints from me at the time

wrbguLqoI1zhyqFWq-a2_g.text: I love pei wei but this is the worst one I've ever been to. I've gone to this location 4 times hoping that it was just a bad day for the restaurant but I've had a bad experience each time I come. Will not be coming again.

-e32Gj-Mth0V9Tf1OGp87w.text: Along with the food having a burnt odor and taste, the food was essentially flavorless and tasted as if it was simply being reheated after being frozen. You could get the same quality and flavor profile from purchasing a TV dinner from your local supermarket.

oUiTPoKfPgRzbaHRWwz6Wg.text: The food looks nice and authentic. I ordered to make sure I had something kosher. The other person obviously had what they wanted and it all looks great! The Japanese Steak & Shrimp Chile Ramen. Then the Chicken Chow Mein is Hot and fresh. I just love the fact that it's not fried in grease like so many other places. We know that it is supposed to be a franchise but of course we'll see how long this one hangs around. As long as they keep on the menu what they have I think they should stay around for quite a while. I'm still not convinced about purchasing the Cauliflower bowl just yet. I know how to make my own so we'll see.

photos.caption: Photo of Pei Wei - Charlotte, NC, United States
